name: CaptureFlags
description: Specifies the type of data to be captured:

values.name: wrm
values.description: Session recording file.

values.name: session_log
values.description: keyboard log in session log

values.name: wrm
values.description: keyboard log in recorded sessions

values.name: wrm
values.description: clipboard log in recorded sessions

values.name: meta
values.description: clipboard log in recorded meta

values.name: wrm
values.description: (redirected) file system log in recorded sessions

values.name: meta
values.description: (redirected) file system log in recorded meta

name: ColorDepth
description: Specifies the maximum color depth for the client connection session:

values.name: depth8
values.description: 8-bit

values.name: depth15
values.description: 15-bit 555 RGB mask

values.name: depth16
values.description: 16-bit 565 RGB mask

values.name: depth24
values.description: 24-bit RGB mask

values.name: depth32
values.description: 32-bit RGB mask + alpha

values.name: SIEM
values.description: message sent to SIEM

name: ServerCertCheck
info: System errors like FS access rights issues or certificate decode are always check errors leading to connection rejection.

values.name: fails_if_no_match_or_missing
values.description: fails if certificates do not match or are missing.

values.name: fails_if_no_match_and_succeed_if_no_know
values.description: fails if certificate does not match, succeeds if no known certificate.

values.name: succeed_if_exists_and_fails_if_missing
values.description: succeeds if certificates exist (not checked), fails if missing.

values.name: always_succeed
values.description: always succeed.

name: TraceType
info: When session records are encrypted, they can be read only by the WALLIX Bastion where they have been generated.

values.name: localfile
values.description: No encryption (faster).

values.name: localfile_hashed
values.description: No encryption, with checksum.

values.name: cryptofile
values.description: Encryption enabled.

values.name: unmasked
values.description: Keyboard inputs are not masked.

values.name: password_only
values.description: Only passwords are masked.

values.name: password_and_unidentified
values.description: Passwords and unidentified texts are masked.

values.name: fully_masked
values.description: Keyboard inputs are not logged.

name: SessionProbeOnLaunchFailure
description: Behavior on failure to launch Session Probe.

values.name: ignore_and_continue
values.description: The metadata collected is not essential for us. Instead, we prefer to minimize the impact on the user experience. The Session Probe launch will be in best-effort mode. The prevailing duration is defined by the 'Launch fallback timeout' instead of the 'Launch timeout'.

values.name: disconnect_user
values.description: This is the recommended setting. If the target meets all the technical prerequisites, there is no reason for the Session Probe not to launch. All that remains is to adapt the value of 'Launch timeout' to the performance of the target.

values.name: retry_without_session_probe
values.description: We wish to be able to recover the behavior of Bastion 5 when the Session Probe does not launch. The prevailing duration is defined by the 'Launch fallback timeout' instead of the 'Launch timeout'.

values.name: delayed
values.description: Clipboard processing is deferred and, if necessary, the token is left with the client.

values.name: duplicated
values.description: When 2 identical requests are received, the second is ignored. This can block clipboard data reception until a clipboard event is triggered on the target server when the client clipboard is blocked, and vice versa.

values.name: continued
values.description: No special processing is done, the proxy always responds immediately.

name: ColorDepthSelectionStrategy
description: Color depth for the Session Recording file (.wrm):

values.name: depth24
values.description: 24-bit

values.name: depth16
values.description: 16-bit

name: WrmCompressionAlgorithm
description: Compression method of the Session Recording file (.wrm):

values.name: gzip
values.description: GZip: Files are better compressed, but this takes more time and CPU load.

values.name: snappy
values.description: Snappy: Faster than GZip, but files are less compressed.

name: RdpCompression
description: Specifies the highest RDP compression support available

values.name: none
values.description: The RDP bulk compression is disabled

values.name: rdp4
values.description: RDP 4.0 bulk compression

values.name: rdp5
values.description: RDP 5.0 bulk compression

values.name: rdp6
values.description: RDP 6.0 bulk compression

values.name: rdp6_1
values.description: RDP 6.1 bulk compression

values.name: latin
values.description: Recognizes Latin characters

values.name: cyrillic
values.description: Recognizes Latin and Cyrillic characters

values.name: ignore_and_continue
values.description: Designed to minimize the impact on the user experience if the Session Probe is unstable. It should not be used when Session Probe is working well. An attacker can take advantage of this setting by simulating a Session Probe crash in order to bypass the surveillance.

values.name: disconnect_user
values.description: Legacy behavior. It’s a choice that gives more security, but the impact on the user experience seems disproportionate. The RDP session can be closed (resulting in the permanent loss of all its unsaved elements) if the 'End disconnected session' parameter (or an equivalent setting at the RDS-level) is enabled.

values.name: freeze_connection_and_wait
values.description: This is the recommended setting. User actions will be blocked until contact with the Session Probe (reply to KeepAlive message or something else) is resumed.

values.name: disable
values.description: When replaying the session video, the content of the RDP viewer matches the size of the client's desktop.

values.name: v1
values.description: When replaying the session video, the content of the RDP viewer is restricted to the greatest area covered by the application during the session.

values.name: v2
values.description: When replaying the session video, the content of the RDP viewer is fully covered by the size of the greatest application window during the session.

values.name: allow
values.description: Forward Console mode request from client to the target.

values.name: force
values.description: Force Console mode on target regardless of client request.

values.name: forbid
values.description: Block Console mode request from client.

values.name: jab
values.description: Java Access Bridge. General user activity monitoring in the Java applications (including detection of password fields).

values.name: msaa
values.description: MS Active Accessbility. General user activity monitoring (including detection of password fields). (legacy API)

values.name: msuia
values.description: MS UI Automation. General user activity monitoring (including detection of password fields). (new API)

values.name: edge_inspection
values.description: Inspect Edge location URL. Basic web navigation monitoring.

values.name: chrome_inspection
values.description: Inspect Chrome Address/Search bar. Basic web navigation monitoring.

values.name: firefox_inspection
values.description: Inspect Firefox Address/Search bar. Basic web navigation monitoring.

values.name: ie_monitoring
values.description: Monitor Internet Explorer event. Advanced web navigation monitoring.

values.name: group_membership
values.description: Inspect group membership of user. User identity monitoring.

values.name: never
values.description: Never store transferred files.

values.name: always
values.description: Always store transferred files.

values.name: on_invalid_verification
values.description: Transferred files are stored only if file verification is invalid. File verification by ICAP service must be enabled (in section file_verification).

name: SessionProbeOnAccountManipulation
description: For targets running WALLIX BestSafe only.

values.name: allow
values.description: User action will be accepted.

values.name: notify
values.description: (Same thing as 'allow'.)

values.name: deny
values.description: User action will be rejected.

name: ClientAddressSent
description: Client Address to send to target(in InfoPacket)

values.name: proxy
values.description: Send proxy client address or target connexion.

values.name: front
values.description: Send user client address of front connexion.

values.name: Fatal
values.description: Designates very severe error events that will presumably lead the application to abort.

values.name: Error
values.description: Designates error events that might still allow the application to continue running.

values.name: Info
values.description: Designates informational messages that highlight the progress of the application at coarse-grained level.

values.name: Warning
values.description: Designates potentially harmful situations.

values.name: Debug
values.description: Designates fine-grained informational events that are mostly useful to debug an application.

values.name: Detail
values.description: Designates finer-grained informational events than Debug.

values.name: Auto
values.description: The language is determined based on the keyboard layout specified by the client.

values.name: Restart
values.description: Restart the Session Probe. May result in session disconnection due to loss of KeepAlive messages! Refer to 'On keepalive timeout' parameter of current section and 'Allow multiple handshakes' parameter of 'Configuration options'.

values.name: Stop
values.description: Stop the Session Probe. May result in session disconnection due to loss of KeepAlive messages! Refer to 'On keepalive timeout' parameter of current section.

values.name: windows_management_instrumentation
values.description: Get command-line of processes via Windows Management Instrumentation. (Legacy method)

values.name: windows_internals
values.description: Calling internal system APIs to get the process command line. (More efficient but less stable)

values.name: both
values.description: First use internal system APIs call, if that fails, use Windows Management Instrumentation method.

values.name: Supported
values.description: Windows

values.name: UnsupportedOrUnknown
values.description: Bastion, xrdp or others
